head.title: Bush Likely to Delay A Texas Execution

hedline.hl1: Bush Likely to Delay A Texas Execution

block.p: Gov. George W. Bush of Texas said he was ''more than likely'' to delay the execution scheduled today of a convicted killer so that DNA evidence in the case can be tested. It would be the first such stay Mr. Bush has issued as governor.

Gov. George W. Bush of Texas said he was ''more than likely'' to delay the execution scheduled today of a convicted killer so that DNA evidence in the case can be tested. It would be the first such stay Mr. Bush has issued as governor.

The case of Ricky Nolen McGinn, 43, who was convicted of raping and murdering his stepdaughter in 1993, has quietly been working its way through the legal system. But with Mr. Bush now the presumptive Republican presidential nominee, it has taken on political significance. Article, Page A27.
